SEARCH
Package mathematics

Class Tensor

java.lang.Object
mathematics.MultiDimObject
mathematics.Tensor
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterable<Value>
public class Tensor extends MultiDimObject
Represents a three-dimensional tensor of Value objects. This class facilitates the manipulation and operation of data in a multi-dimensional array format, which is essential in neural network computations and other mathematical applications.

  • Nested Class Summary

  • Constructor Details

    • Tensor

      public Tensor(int height, int width, int depth, MultiDimObject.InitValues init_values)
      Constructs a tensor with specified dimensions and initialization.
      Parameters:
      height - The number of rows in the tensor.
      width - The number of columns in the tensor.
      depth - The depth or third dimension of the tensor.
      init_values - The method for initializing the tensor values, using predefined schemes like ZEROS, ONES, etc.

    • Tensor

      public Tensor(Value[][][] tensor)
      Constructs a tensor from a three-dimensional array of Value objects.
      Parameters:
      tensor - A three-dimensional array of Value objects to initialize the tensor.

    • Tensor

      public Tensor(Matrix[] matrices)
      Constructs a tensor from an array of Matrix objects.
      Parameters:
      matrices - An array of Matrix objects, each representing a "slice" or layer of the tensor.

    • Tensor

      public Tensor(double[][][] tensor)
      Constructs a tensor from a three-dimensional array of double values.
      Parameters:
      tensor - A three-dimensional array of doubles to initialize the tensor.

  • Method Details

    • slice

      public Tensor slice(int[] x, int[] y)
      Extracts a sub-tensor from this tensor, specified by range indices in two dimensions. This method creates a view or sub-tensor based on the specified slice indices for rows and columns.
      Parameters:
      x - An array of two integers specifying the start and end indices for the row dimension. The end index is exclusive.
      y - An array of two integers specifying the start and end indices for the column dimension. The end index is exclusive.
      Returns:
      A new Tensor representing the sliced portion of this tensor.
      Throws:
      ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - If the length of either 'x' or 'y' is not exactly two, or if the indices are out of the valid range of this tensor's dimensions.

    • pw_multiply

      public Tensor pw_multiply(Tensor other)
      Performs an element-wise (pairwise) multiplication of this tensor with another tensor. Both tensors must have the same size. The result is a new tensor where each element is the product of corresponding elements from this tensor and the other tensor.
      Parameters:
      other - The tensor to multiply with this tensor.
      Returns:
      A new tensor representing the element-wise product.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - If the other tensor is not of the same size.

    • add

      public Tensor add(MultiDimObject other)
      Adds a tensor to this tensor and returns the result as a new tensor.
      Specified by:
      add in class MultiDimObject
      Parameters:
      other - The tensor to add to this tensor.
      Returns:
      A new tensor representing the sum of this tensor and the other tensor.

    • multiply

      public Tensor multiply(double constant)
      Multiplies each element of this tensor with a constant and returns the result as a new tensor.
      Parameters:
      constant - The constant to multiply with each element of the tensor.
      Returns:
      A new tensor where each element is the product of the original element and the constant.

    • has_same_size

      public boolean has_same_size(MultiDimObject other)
      Determines if another MultiDimObject (such as another Tensor) has the same size as this tensor.
      Specified by:
      has_same_size in class MultiDimObject
      Parameters:
      other - The other MultiDimObject to compare against.
      Returns:
      true if the other object has the same dimensions as this tensor; false otherwise.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the other object is null.

    • set_requires_grad

      public void set_requires_grad(boolean requires_grad)
      Sets the 'requires_grad' property for all elements within the tensor, determining whether automatic differentiation mechanisms should track operations for each element.
      Parameters:
      requires_grad - Boolean flag indicating whether gradients should be calculated.

    • is_vector

      public boolean is_vector()
      Checks if the tensor qualifies as a vector, defined as having a size of 1 in two dimensions.
      Specified by:
      is_vector in class MultiDimObject
      Returns:
      true if the tensor is a vector; false otherwise.

    • sum

      public Value sum()
      Calculates the sum of all elements in the tensor.
      Returns:
      A Value object representing the sum of all elements.

    • set

      public void set(Value value, int... indices)
      Sets a specified value at given indices within the tensor.
      Parameters:
      value - The value to set within the tensor.
      indices - The indices where the value should be set, expected as an array of three integers.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - If the number of indices is not three.
      ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - If the indices are out of the tensor's bounds.
      NullPointerException - If the provided value is null.

    • get

      public Value get(int... indices)
      Retrieves a value from the tensor at specified indices.
      Specified by:
      get in class MultiDimObject
      Parameters:
      indices - An array of three integers representing the indices of the value to retrieve.
      Returns:
      The value at the specified indices.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - If the number of indices provided is not three.
      ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - If the indices are out of the tensor's bounds.

    • get_dim

      public Matrix get_dim(int dim)
      Extracts a specific dimension from the tensor as a Matrix. This is often used in operations that need to process or manipulate one layer or slice of a tensor at a time.
      Parameters:
      dim - The dimension index to extract, corresponding to the third dimension of the tensor.
      Returns:
      A Matrix containing the specified dimension's data.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - If the specified dimension index is out of bounds.

    • relu

      public Tensor relu()
      Applies the Rectified Linear Unit (ReLU) activation function to each element of the tensor. The ReLU function is defined as f(x) = max(0, x), setting all negative elements to zero and keeping positive values unchanged.
      Returns:
      A new Tensor with the ReLU activation function applied to each element.

    • leakyRelu

      public Tensor leakyRelu()
      Applies the Leaky Rectified Linear Unit (LeakyReLU) activation function to each element of the tensor. The LeakyReLU function allows a small, positive gradient when the unit is not active: f(x) = x for x > 0, and f(x) = 0.01 * x for x less than 0.
      Returns:
      A new Tensor with the LeakyReLU activation function applied to each element.

    • sigmoid

      public Tensor sigmoid()
      Applies the Sigmoid activation function to each element of the tensor. The Sigmoid function is defined as f(x) = 1 / (1 + exp(-x)), which squashes each element to a range between 0 and 1, making it suitable for probabilities or models where outputs are binary.
      Returns:
      A new Tensor with the Sigmoid activation function applied to each element.

    • activation

      protected Tensor activation(Layer.Activation activation)
      Applies an activation function (ReLU, LeakyReLU, Sigmoid) to each element of the tensor and returns the result as a new tensor.
      Parameters:
      activation - The activation function to apply.
      Returns:
      A new tensor with the activation function applied to each element.

    • iterator

      public Iterator<Value> iterator()
      Provides an iterator over the elements of the tensor, flattening all dimensions.
      Returns:
      An iterator that allows iterating over all elements of the tensor.

    • print

      public void print()
      Prints the tensor to the standard output in a formatted manner.
      Specified by:
      print in class MultiDimObject
